body:
Sorry for late reply, i have checked your PR, it contains some really valuable improvements:
* Support Generic Invoke
* Avoid keeping reference of invokers

But i still got some questions:
1. identityhashcode will only change when providers(invokers) change(increase/reduce/override, anything that will cause recreation of invokers), this will trigger the recreation of `ConsistentHashSelector`, but it won't reschedule the hash circle, the existing invoker will still be in the same position.
2. Instead of calculating hashcode of invokers, how about add customized `hashcode()` for Invoker?
Good to hear this news in The Spring Festival.

Hi, Adam74211

That's a good proposal, actually i have been considering this improvement, including future check and heartbeat.

It would be great if you'd like to contribute your implementation

@ducat7 I think i understand your requirement now, do you mean `'http request'` when saying `URL`? I mistook it as `Dubbo URL`. 

Which protocol do you use, `http` or `hessian`? I think `attachments` should be the proper way to achieve this, but i remember that `attachments` doesn't support `http` and `hessian` currently. 

> 如此，Dubbo发送的URL里只要添加特定参数，那么，Spring Session首先拦截获取到sessionId就可以共> 享session了，不必变更业务代码了。否则，重构量很大。

What position should the parameter be added to the URL, will a request header work？

Have you find why it doesn't work?
I am sure dubbo-admin will read ZK configuration from dubbo.properties, please check.

@wxiaoguang @lovepoem @kimmking  Do you guys think it will be better to catch this exception earlier? For example catch it in `DubboProtocol` or `Server` and reassign port.

Or instead of wrapping with RpcException in DubboProtocol can we throw the original Exception directly to ServiceConfig? Just as HessianProtocol do.
Would you like to create a PR?
Congratulations！

Thanks for your advice, actually `ReferenceConfigCache` is a reference implementation for users. We highly recommend you cache any ReferenceConfig instances, and recommend you implement your own cache tools.

Anyway, the current official implementation do need improvement, we'll discuss improve it or not and how to improve it.

Welcome create a PR if you have any good ideas.
@shiqingshun Yes, that will work, good job.
Thanks for your reply, I understand what you mean.

You can use <dubbo:parameter/>, like this:
```xml
<dubbo:service>
    <dubbo:parameter name="connect.timout" value="5000" />
</dubbo:service>
``'

Sorry, i can't load the pictures at this moment. But be notice there's two telnet ways currently in dubbo:  `new qos` and `old telnet`. 
All configurations works only for `new qos`.
Wonderful!
REALLY NICE
Great Job

@ducat7 The embedded tomcat doesn't support loading of web.xml. Please use servlet instead:
```xml
<dubbo:protocol name="http" port="10080" server="servlet" contextpath="api" />
```
Use a container to load your dubbo project and web.xml yourself

The `old telnet` can't be closed, though the `telnet` property is designed for user to configure, it is never used. 

I am not sure whether we will continue working on `old telnet`, because we plan to replace it with the `qos` module.

> in version 2.5.9,use confs
> dubbo.application.qos.port=33333 dubbo.application.qos.enable=true
> I still can not open the qos

Where do you place these properties?
done
Reference this issue here dubbo/dubbo-ops#1
@shenzhuan Can you create a issue and give more details of your problem?
Can you please create a PR?
Have you create a new PR to replace this one?
I have noticed that the PR #1239 being closed? Can you create a new one please?

@skykong1981 Thanks for your kindness and sorry for the late reply. 
I think we'd better discuss here, so people in community can join us, i think your work is of great value. You send a PR, and we can discuss the implementation details.
I think we can discuss the problems of ConsistentHashLoadbalance in #1144, this PR also mentioned the memory leak problem.
I leaved some message in the PR #1144, please check.

@zhuoyuehc The route policy treats `rest`, `dubbo` and any other protocols as the same, so it should works for rest.

I suggest you check the data write to your registry first, for example, if you use ZK, check the data under /dubbo/your service/routers/
Yes, it does not handles async invoke, we can track the issue in dubbo/dubbo-ops#8
Dubbo uses `hessian2` as default serialization protocol, define a dubbo service and make a remote call, the data class will be serialized automatically using the protocol you specified.
We plan to integrate with existing RX frameworks now.
Currently, dubbo-monitor is only a reference implementation, it is not suitable for large-scale use cases.
Yes, you need to define extra RegistryService using another Registry address and customize RegistryServerSync.
Try to use `<dubbo:parameter key="connect.timeout" value="xxx" />`.
We haven't verified it in this version yet
When using N/A, you have to specify the provider address.
Dubbo should support specify id of ServiceBean registered to Spring.
We will devote more energy on requirement evaluation after the vacation and try to make a detailed development plan.

If the timeout for every future is 1.9s, the most cost for all results will be 1.9s or a little higher.
Because when future1 timed out, future2 and future-n will also timed out, they will return immediately.
Any more information? Thread stack and time distribution?

> ubboServerHandler-10.10.56.20:7778-thread-111" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f20584d6800 nid=0x5cb waiting on condition [0x00007f2052cab000]
> java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
> at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
> - parking to wait for <0x0000000781f949d0> (a java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue$TransferStack)
> at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:156)
> at java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue$TransferStack.awaitFulfill(SynchronousQueue.java:422)
> at java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue$TransferStack.transfer(SynchronousQueue.java:323)
> at java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue.take(SynchronousQueue.java:857)
> at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:957)
> at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:917)
> at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
> 
> Locked ownable synchronizers:
> - None

All threads seems to be idle and are waiting for a new request?

I find that you use dubbox 2.8.4, do you use both dubbo and dubbox? dubbox has changed the core rpc protocol and it has compatibility problem with dubbo.

This can be achieved by add customized router rule, current route can support this.
And we plan to enhance the router functionality.

Sorry, there is no explanation for this command at this moment, you can check [source code](https://github.com/alibaba/dubbo/blob/master/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-default/src/main/java/com/alibaba/dubbo/rpc/protocol/dubbo/status/ThreadPoolStatusChecker.java) for details

The error promotion is clear enough:
```xml
<dubbo:application name="custsrv" id="custsrv" /> and <dubbo:application name="custsrv" id="custsrv2" />
```
It seems to be a bug of dubbo-admin
dubbo/dubbo-ops#9
In 2.5.9, you can use `dubbo.qos.enable=true/false` to open or close qos.

Hi, welcome to Dubbo community!

If it is a feature request, please use English to submit. Dubbo is a global community, and all the issues may be viewed and discussed by people all over the world.

Thanks @chickenlj . The old code is 
```
"Unsupported request: " + message == null ? null : (message.getClass().getName() + ": " + message)
```

I added two brackets：
```
"Unsupported request: " + (message == null ? null : (message.getClass().getName() + ": " + message))
```
